body.p: In the context of an employee share option, grant date is when the entity and the employee enter into an agreement, whereby the employee is granted rights to the share option, provided that specified conditions are met, such as the employee’s remaining in the entity’s employ for a specified period. Service date is the date when the employee renders the services necessary to become entitled to the share option. Vesting date is the date when the employee has satisfied all the conditions necessary to become entitled to the share option. For example, if the employee is required to remain in the entity’s employ for three years, vesting date is at the end of that three‑year period. Exercise date is when the share option is exercised.
